title: Pierre-Étienne Guyot
text:
Pierre-Étienne Guyot (21 May 1905 – 13 October 1985) was a French sports executive. He notably was president of the from 1970 to 1981, president of the <a href="F%C3%A9d%C3%A9ration%20Internationale%20de%20Tir%20aux%20Armes%20Sportives%20de%20Chasse">Fédération Internationale de Tir aux Armes Sportives de Chasse</a> from 1972 to 1981, vice president of <a href="Racing%20Club%20de%20France">Racing Club de France</a>, president of <a href="Paris%20Saint-Germain%20F.C.">Paris Saint-Germain</a> from 1970 to 1971, and president of <a href="Paris%20FC">Paris FC</a> from 1969 to 1970 and 1972 to 1973.
Paris FC and Paris Saint-Germain.
In the summer of 1970, Guyot was collaborating with <a href="Guy%20Crescent">Guy Crescent</a> and <a href="Henri%20Patrelle">Henri Patrelle</a> to form a new <a href="Association%20football">football</a> club. Eventually, it was agreed upon that Guyot and Crescent's virtual <a href="Paris%20FC">Paris FC</a> would merge with Patrelle's <a href="Stade%20Saint-Germain">Stade Saint-Germain</a> to form <a href="Paris%20Saint-Germain%20F.C.">Paris Saint-Germain</a>. Guyot became the first president of the newly-founded club. However, he was succeeded in this role after one year by Crescent. In 1972, PSG split into two, and PFC was re-formed; Guyot subsequently returned to preside the club for one year.
